title: Add accordion component using details element
description: Native HTML accordion using <details>/<summary> elements with smooth open/close animations. Uses modern CSS: @starting-style for entry animations and transition-behavior: allow-discrete for animating display property. No JavaScript required. Should support light/dark themes and integrate with Graffiti's theming system. Reference: MDN details element with CSS discrete transitions.

title: Add avatar element
description: Single avatar element - circular image container with sizing options. Basic building block for user representation. Should support multiple sizes via CSS custom properties or modifier classes, and integrate with Graffiti's theming system.

title: Add user menu component
description: User menu component combining avatar as trigger for dropdown menu. A common UI pattern for user account navigation. Should compose existing .avatar and .dropdown components together. Features: avatar as clickable trigger button, dropdown menu with user info header, menu items for profile/settings/logout, works with both image avatars and initials. This is a 'block' - a composed pattern using existing elements.

title: Add dialog component using native dialog element
description: Native modal/dialog using HTML <dialog> element. No JavaScript required for basic show/hide - uses CSS and native dialog behaviors. Should support backdrop styling, open/close animations with @starting-style and allow-discrete, light/dark themes, and integrate with Graffiti's existing .di-dialog styles.

title: Add dropdown menu component using popover
description: Dropdown menu using native HTML popover API and CSS anchor positioning. No JavaScript required for open/close. Should support: trigger button, menu container, optional header section, menu items, dividers between sections. Light/dark themes and integrate with Graffiti's theming system. Reference: Tailwind UI 'With simple header' dropdown pattern.

title: Add tooltip element using popover and anchor positioning
description: Native tooltip using HTML popover attribute and CSS anchor positioning. No JavaScript required - pure HTML/CSS implementation. Should support positioning (top, bottom, left, right), light/dark themes, and integrate with Graffiti's theming system. Uses modern CSS: anchor-name, position-anchor, and popover API.

title: Add CodeExample demos for carousel, button, and callout
Add file dropzone component
description: File upload dropzone area - drag-and-drop styled zone for file inputs. Should include: dashed border styling, hover/dragover states, icon/text placeholder, click-to-upload fallback. Works with native file input. Integrates with Graffiti's theming system for light/dark modes.

title: Re-layout docs with sidebar and multi-page structure
description: Reorganize src/routes/+page.svelte documentation to be more organized. Current page is a single long page with all demos. Needs: sidebar navigation, multiple pages/routes for different sections (Typography, Layouts, Elements, Components, Utilities, CSS Variables), clear structure. Consider grouping: Typography, Layouts, Elements, Components, Utilities, and CSS Variables Reference into separate routes.

title: Add CodeExample Svelte component for docs
description:
Create a reusable Svelte 5 component for documentation code examples using svelte-highlight (https://github.com/metonym/svelte-highlight).

Similar to https://base-ui.com/react/components/accordion but simpler - since Graffiti is CSS-only, no props table or API reference needed. Just:
1. Live preview in a resizable container
2. Syntax-highlighted source code

Requirements:
- Accept a demo component as a prop
- Import the demo as both:
  1. A rendered component (to display in a resizable preview box)
  2. A raw string (for syntax highlighting with svelte-highlight)
- Resizable preview container so users can test responsive behavior
- Syntax highlighted code block showing the source
- Should work with Graffiti's light/dark theming
- Svelte 5 patterns only (runes, snippets, etc.)
- Clean, minimal UI - let the examples speak for themselves

Reference: https://github.com/metonym/svelte-highlight

title: Re-categorize docs into base, element, forms, ui-components, blocks
description:
Reorganize documentation categories to match the component taxonomy.

FINAL CATEGORIES:

1) BASE - tokens + default element styles (no classes, just foundation)
   - CSS custom property tokens (spacing, colors, shadows, borders, line-heights, easing)
   - Default HTML element styles (h1-h6 elements, body, links, img, etc.)

2) LAYOUT - structural patterns
   - .layout-card, .layout-sidebar, .layout-split, .layout-three-col
   - .layout-readable, .layout-holy-grail, .full-bleed
   - .stack, .cluster, .carousel, .reel, .flex, .grid, .split, .readable

3) ELEMENT - standalone building blocks
   - .box (+ .box-ghost, .box-glow, .box-semi-gloss)
   - button/.button (+ .mini, .primary, .error, .warning, .success, .ghost)
   - table/.table
   - .callout (+ .warning, .error, .ghost, .success, .hard)
   - .circle

4) FORMS - form inputs and validation
   - input, select, textarea base styles
   - label
   - Validation states (.error, .success, .warning)

5) UI-COMPONENTS - composed components
   - .swipe (+ .stop, .full-bleed)

6) BLOCKS - full patterns
   - .header (+ .border, .sticky)

7) UTILITIES - modifier/helper classes
   - .auto-color (+ .chroma)
   - .fc (fluid container)
   - .h1-.h6 (heading styles on non-headings)
   - .fs-* (font size utilities)
   - .visually-hidden, .no-list, .row, .aspect-*

title: Add demo component with code toggle
description: Reusable demo component for documentation that displays both live preview and source code. Features: live demo view (default), toggle button to switch to code view, syntax highlighting for code, copy code button (optional). Used to showcase all Graffiti components in docs with their implementation.

title: Add .layout-sidebar.fill modifier for full-height sticky sidebars
Add breadcrumbs component
description: Simple breadcrumb navigation with slash (/) separators. Minimal design showing navigation hierarchy trail. Should support light/dark themes, current page indicator (non-linked), and work with Graffiti's theming system. Reference: Tailwind UI 'Simple with slashes' breadcrumbs pattern.

title: Add pagination component
description: Card footer style pagination with page number buttons. Includes previous/next navigation controls and individual page number buttons. Should support light/dark themes via Graffiti's theming system, disabled states for prev/next at boundaries, and current page indicator. Reference: Tailwind UI 'Card footer with page buttons' pattern.

title: Add panel component
description: Basic panel/drawer container component. Minimal 'empty' style - a slide-in panel structure without specific content. Provides the base container styling that can hold any content. Should support multiple origin directions via modifier classes (.left, .right, .top, .bottom). Should support light/dark themes and integrate with Graffiti's existing .di-drawer styles. Reference: Tailwind UI 'Empty' drawer pattern.

title: Add stacked avatars component
description:
Stacked/overlapping avatar component based on Temani Afif's technique (codepen.io/t_afif/pen/mdoyOqb). Static version without hover animation. Uses CSS mask with radial-gradient for circular cutouts, flexbox for layout, and CSS custom properties for sizing (--s for size, --o for overlap amount).

Reference: https://css-tricks.com/responsive-list-of-avatars-using-modern-css-part-1/

title: Add dialog footer component
description: Dialog/modal footer layout component. The specific button content doesn't matter - this is about the general layout structure and styling for action buttons at the bottom of dialogs. Should support light/dark themes and integrate with Graffiti's existing .di-dialog styles.

title: Add toggle switch component
description: Modern toggle/switch input component. Variations to consider: simple toggle, short/compact toggle, toggle with icons (check/x), toggle with label positioning (left/right). Should be accessible (proper checkbox semantics), support disabled state, and work with CSS custom properties for theming. Reference: Tailwind UI toggle patterns.

title: Create demo for .layout-sidebar.fill and .split.vertical
Add default checkbox and radio input styles
description: Default styles for native checkbox and radio inputs - no classes required. Should include: nice spacing between input and label, proper alignment, consistent sizing, focus states, checked states, and disabled states. Works out of the box with standard HTML markup. Integrates with Graffiti's theming system for light/dark modes.

title: Add login form block
description: Complete login form block - a composition of form elements (inputs, labels, button, forgot password link, etc.) that work together as a ready-to-use login pattern. Should integrate with Graffiti's form styles and theming system.

title: Add .split.vertical modifier for vertical space-between layout
